commit_message:
Split trusts_client from keystone V3 client

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I655830deb066c15682fe40ba713e27c695827bc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/73/279073/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json from tempest.common import service_client class TrustsV3Client(service_client.ServiceClient): api_version = "v3" def create_trust(self, **kwargs): """Creates a trust. Available params: see http://developer.openstack.org/ api-ref-identity-v3-ext.html#createTrust """ post_body = json.dumps({'trust': kwargs}) resp, body = self.post('OS-TRUST/trusts', post_body) self.expected_success(201, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def delete_trust(self, trust_id): """Deletes a trust.""" resp, body = self.delete("OS-TRUST/trusts/%s" % trust_id) self.expected_success(204, resp.status) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def list_trusts(self, trustor_user_id=None, trustee_user_id=None): """GET trusts.""" if trustor_user_id: resp, body = self.get("OS-TRUST/trusts?trustor_user_id=%s" % trustor_user_id) elif trustee_user_id: resp, body = self.get("OS-TRUST/trusts?trustee_user_id=%s" % trustee_user_id) else: resp, body = self.get("OS-TRUST/trusts") self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def show_trust(self, trust_id): """GET trust.""" resp, body = self.get("OS-TRUST/trusts/%s" % trust_id) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def list_trust_roles(self, trust_id): """GET roles delegated by a trust.""" resp, body = self.get("OS-TRUST/trusts/%s/roles" % trust_id) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def show_trust_role(self, trust_id, role_id): """GET role delegated by a trust.""" resp, body = self.get("OS-TRUST/trusts/%s/roles/%s" % (trust_id, role_id)) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def check_trust_role(self, trust_id, role_id): """HEAD Check if role is delegated by a trust.""" resp, body = self.head("OS-TRUST/trusts/%s/roles/%s" % (trust_id, role_id)) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body)

instead of dicts.

commit_message:
Remove grants for node hostname from mysql.

We are using skip-name-resolve in mysql, so this is not necessary.

Change-Id: I07822443a217d495eb64f5b8b11aa2acd8e91b9a
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency

commit_message:
Use versionedobjects in scality volume driver

Update scality volume driver to use versionedobjects
instead of dicts.

Change-Id: I407fb5ea5a426e9c22f92a7d367183e63debdfbe

commit_message:
Use versionedobjects in quobyte volume driver

Update quobyte volume driver to use versionedobjects
instead of dicts.

Change-Id: I457ed08ca8fc29b897f6e79fa0a80382c1f3e97a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/54/261554/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder.tests.unit import fake_snapshot from cinder.tests.unit import fake_volume self.context = context.get_admin_context() volume = self._simple_volume(_name_id='123') def _simple_volume(self, **kwargs): updates = {'id': self.VOLUME_UUID, 'provider_location': self.TEST_QUOBYTE_VOLUME, 'display_name': 'volume-%s' % self.VOLUME_UUID, 'size': 10, 'status': 'available'} updates.update(kwargs) if 'display_name' not in updates: updates['display_name'] = 'volume-%s' % updates['id'] return fake_volume.fake_volume_obj(self.context, **updates) drv._find_share.return_value = self.TEST_QUOBYTE_VOLUME volume = self._simple_volume(size=self.TEST_SIZE_IN_GB) volume = self._simple_volume(size=self.TEST_SIZE_IN_GB) volume = self._simple_volume(display_name='volume-123') volume = self._simple_volume(display_name='volume-123', provider_location=None) id='c1073000-0000-0000-0000-0000000c1073') snapshot = fake_snapshot.fake_snapshot_obj( self.context, volume_name=src_volume.name, display_name='clone-snap-%s' % src_volume.id, size=src_volume.size, volume_size=src_volume.size, volume_id=src_volume.id, id='tmp-snap-%s' % src_volume.id) snapshot.volume = src_volume snap_ref = fake_snapshot.fake_snapshot_obj( self.context, volume_name=src_volume.name, display_name='clone-snap-%s' % src_volume.id, volume_size=src_volume.size, volume_id=src_volume.id, id='tmp-snap-%s' % src_volume.id, status='error') snap_ref.volume = src_volume new_volume = self._simple_volume(size=snap_ref.volume_size) snap_ref = fake_snapshot.fake_snapshot_obj( self.context, volume_name=src_volume.name, display_name='clone-snap-%s' % src_volume.id, volume_size=src_volume.size, volume_id=src_volume.id, id='tmp-snap-%s' % src_volume.id, status='available') snap_ref.volume = src_volume new_volume = self._simple_volume(size=snap_ref.volume_size)
deleted_lines: class DumbVolume(object): fields = {} def __setitem__(self, key, value): self.fields[key] = value def __getitem__(self, item): return self.fields[item] volume = DumbVolume() volume['provider_location'] = self.TEST_QUOBYTE_VOLUME volume['name'] = 'volume-123' def _simple_volume(self, uuid=None): volume = DumbVolume() volume['provider_location'] = self.TEST_QUOBYTE_VOLUME if uuid is None: volume['id'] = self.VOLUME_UUID else: volume['id'] = uuid # volume['name'] mirrors format from db/sqlalchemy/models.py volume['name'] = 'volume-%s' % volume['id'] volume['size'] = 10 volume['status'] = 'available' return volume volume = DumbVolume() volume['size'] = self.TEST_SIZE_IN_GB volume = DumbVolume() volume['size'] = self.TEST_SIZE_IN_GB volume = DumbVolume() volume['name'] = 'volume-123' volume['provider_location'] = self.TEST_QUOBYTE_VOLUME volume = DumbVolume() volume['name'] = 'volume-123' volume['provider_location'] = None 'c1073000-0000-0000-0000-0000000c1073') snapshot = {'volume_name': src_volume['name'], 'name': 'clone-snap-%s' % src_volume['id'], 'size': src_volume['size'], 'volume_size': src_volume['size'], 'volume_id': src_volume['id'], 'id': 'tmp-snap-%s' % src_volume['id'], 'volume': src_volume} snap_ref = {'volume_name': src_volume['name'], 'name': 'clone-snap-%s' % src_volume['id'], 'size': src_volume['size'], 'volume_size': src_volume['size'], 'volume_id': src_volume['id'], 'id': 'tmp-snap-%s' % src_volume['id'], 'volume': src_volume, 'status': 'error'} new_volume = DumbVolume() new_volume['size'] = snap_ref['size'] snap_ref = {'volume_name': src_volume['name'], 'name': 'clone-snap-%s' % src_volume['id'], 'size': src_volume['size'], 'volume_size': src_volume['size'], 'volume_id': src_volume['id'], 'id': 'tmp-snap-%s' % src_volume['id'], 'volume': src_volume, 'status': 'available'} new_volume = DumbVolume() new_volume['size'] = snap_ref['size']

commit_message:
Use versionedobjects in nfs volume driver

Update nfs volume driver to use versionedobjects
instead of dicts.

commit_message:
Use versionedobjects in netapp_nfs unit test

Fix unit test in netapp_nfs unit test so it
will pass after fixing remotefs.py.

Please, note, that I've not fixed the driver, because
it's rather complex, and I'm not familiar with the code.
So I think maintainers can do this job much better.

Change-Id: I89a6b5db1473f8efd0b9ffcf400993141a5fd307

commit_message:
Fix bridge_ports option for linux bridges

Currently, new interface type(vport) was introduced,
but, interface of this type can not be connected to
linux bridge in stored configuration due to condition
checking its type.

Change-Id: I6509e366f00b1276738566919a6c1845ea4eee11
Closes-bug: #1548248
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/60/284260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (!([:absent, :none, :nil, :undef] & self[:bridge]).any? and ([:ethernet, :bond, :vport, :patch].include? self[:if_type] or self[:if_type].nil?))
deleted_lines: if (!([:absent, :none, :nil, :undef] & self[:bridge]).any? and ([:ethernet, :bond].include? self[:if_type] or self[:if_type].nil?))

commit_message:
Tunnel Technologies

Change-Id: Ic541c21a74c88f2551d34db3d438b16b2b3e2b97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/41/284341/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tunneling Technologies Tunneling, also known as port forwarding or encapsulation is a mechanism that makes transfer of payload feasible over an incompatible delivery network. It allows the network user to gain access to another unpermitted or unsecured network. Here the packet is hidden within the IP datagram . Data encryption may be employed to transport the payload. This ensures that the encapsulated user network data appears as public even though it is private and can easily pass the adversary network. Generic Routing Encapsulation GRE GRE is a protocol that runs over IP, generally employed when delivery and payload protocols are compatible but payload addresses are incompatible. For instance a payload might think it is running on a data link layer but, in actual running over transport layer using datagram protocol over IP. GRE creates a private point-to-point connection and works by encapsulating a payload. GRE is a foundation protocol for other tunnel protocols but the GRE tunnels provide only weak authentication. Virtual extensible local area network (VXLAN) Isolated networks present in Cloud Computing. VMware is used to duplicate the addresses of virtual machines for each instance of the application for the very purpose. So the purpose of VXLAN is to provide scalable network isolation. It is an encapsulation method to extend layer 2 traffic over layer 3 network. Basically VXLAN connects two or more layer 3 network domains and make them look like a common layer 2 domain, thereby allowing different VM communicate as if they are on a common layer 2 subnet.

commit_message:
Fix 'dos.py create' command

- do not define network objects twice
- define admin node in shell.py instead of in the Environment
  (like other slave nodes are defined)

Change-Id: I5dfefad9991fde315c1e94e90eeed2a22dc89cd3
Closes-Bug:#1546635

commit_message:
Add package version to plugin create func

Since we use master for a cloning and setup FPB
we should introduce a new argument for a creating
function. This should be '4.0.0' by default for
Fuel 8.0 and to be undefined for Fuel 9.0 to let
FPB builds default 5.0.0 version.

Change-Id: I780b966eba2b73ce3ce004cebd39aefc31c59038
Closes-Bug:1549399

we should introduce a new argument for a creating
function. This should be undefined for Fuel 9.0 to
let FPB builds default 5.0.0 version.

commit_message:
Assign Swift network roles to the same endpoint

There is an additional MOS service 'swiftcheck' which
is set up on controllers only if 'swift/api' and
'swift/replication' roles are assigned to the same L3
network. Modified network template in order to cover
such deployment case by automatic tests.

Change-Id: I5f659d947212ca6bcf8c19580fe85dd279035f36
Related-bug: #1548275

commit_message:
fix int tests

The sym link was not working, looks like the permissions have
changed a bit.  Using sudo to create the sym-link seems to
do the trick.  I'm leaviing in the dir outputs for future
debugging.

Change-Id: I9d2dc9fcdd8f21f49da2a7fc35090c60221b80a3

commit_message:
Update nova service state

The primitive ChangeNovaServiceState allows us to change the state of
the nova-compute by calling nova api. The state of a nova-compute can
be ENABLED or DISABLED, however in the current implementation we use
OFFLINE and ONLINE.

Update the code to use ENABLED or DISABLED.

Change-Id: If3d9726bc5ae980b66c7fd4c5b7986f89d8bc690
Closes-Bug: #1523891

subject: Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 08:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/ssh.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/b4df322481ab22596c674771b228c65aa66e691a', 'message': 'Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh

For example:
You have two networks and two servers:
First server is connected to both networks and can
be reached from world by floating ip.
Second server and network can be reached only from
first server.
In case you need to run command on second
server from tests-you can use this function to do it.
Usual exec_command does not support this feature.

Change-Id: Ib40d5cf42e90b4aa7363ee4a91a54ed64291c034
'}]
commit_message:
Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh

For example:
You have two networks and two servers:
First server is connected to both networks and can
be reached from world by floating ip.
Second server and network can be reached only from
first server.
In case you need to run command on second
server from tests-you can use this function to do it.
Usual exec_command does not support this feature.

Change-Id: Ib40d5cf42e90b4aa7363ee4a91a54ed64291c034
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/74/284574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def exec_command(self, cmd, encoding="utf-8", transport=None): :param object transport: Transport to use for connection if not provided new one will be created if not transport: ssh = self._get_ssh_connection() transport = ssh.get_transport() @staticmethod def get_private_key_from_string(private_key_string): file_like = six.StringIO.StringIO(private_key_string) private_key = paramiko.RSAKey.from_private_key(file_obj=file_like) file_like.close() return private_key def exec_command_on_remote_server(self, remote_server_ip, cmd, proxy_username=None, proxy_key=None, remote_username=None, remote_key=None): """Runs command on remote server (nested ssh) Remote server can be only reached from self.host :param str proxy_username: Username on proxy host :param str remote_server_ip: Ip of remote server to run command on :param str cmd: Command to run at remote server. :param str remote_username: Username to connect to proxy host. if not provided - self.username will be used :param str proxy_key: String with private key to connect to proxy host. If not provided self.key_filename will be used :param str remote_username: Remote host user, if not provided self.username will be used :param str remote_key: String with private key to connect to remote server. If not provided self.key_filename will be used. :returns: data read from standard output of the command. """ proxy_username = proxy_username or self.username remote_username = remote_username or self.username proxy_connection = paramiko.Transport((self.host, 22)) proxy_connection.start_client() if proxy_key: private_key = Client.get_private_key_from_string(proxy_key) else: private_key = self.pkey proxy_connection.auth_publickey(proxy_username, private_key) channel = proxy_connection.open_channel('direct-tcpip', (remote_server_ip, 22), ('127.0.0.1', 0)) transport = paramiko.Transport(channel) transport.start_client() if remote_key: remote_private_key = Client.get_private_key_from_string(remote_key) else: remote_private_key = self.pkey transport.auth_publickey(remote_username, remote_private_key) try: command_result = self.exec_command(cmd, transport=transport) finally: transport.close() proxy_connection.close() return command_result
deleted_lines: def exec_command(self, cmd, encoding="utf-8"): ssh = self._get_ssh_connection() transport = ssh.get_transport()

commit_message:
Creates flavor* tables in API database

Creates the tables "flavors", "flavor_extra_specs" and "flavor_projects"
in the API database for cellsV2.

Co-Authored-By: Lalit Dagre <lalitdagre@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6cdba5cc98a9f1595ef89244c47e9f63805451e7
Implements: blueprint flavor-cell-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/201606/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_004(self, engine, data): # flavors for column in ['created_at', 'updated_at', 'deleted_at', 'name', 'id', 'memory_mb', 'vcpus', 'swap', 'vcpu_weight', 'flavorid', 'rxtx_factor', 'root_gb', 'ephemeral_gb', 'disabled', 'is_public', 'deleted']: self.assertColumnExists(engine, 'flavors', column) self.assertUniqueConstraintExists(engine, 'flavors', ['name', 'deleted']) self.assertUniqueConstraintExists(engine, 'flavors', ['flavorid', 'deleted']) # flavor_extra_specs for column in ['created_at', 'updated_at', 'deleted_at', 'id', 'flavor_id', 'key', 'value', 'deleted']: self.assertColumnExists(engine, 'flavor_extra_specs', column) self.assertIndexExists(engine, 'host_mappings', 'host_idx') self.assertUniqueConstraintExists(engine, 'flavor_extra_specs', ['flavor_id', 'key', 'deleted']) inspector = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(engine) # There should only be one foreign key here fk = inspector.get_foreign_keys('flavor_extra_specs')[0] self.assertEqual('flavors', fk['referred_table']) self.assertEqual(['id'], fk['referred_columns']) self.assertEqual(['flavor_id'], fk['constrained_columns']) # flavor_projects for column in ['created_at', 'updated_at', 'deleted_at', 'id', 'flavor_id', 'project_id', 'deleted']: self.assertColumnExists(engine, 'flavor_projects', column) self.assertUniqueConstraintExists(engine, 'flavor_extra_specs', ['flavor_id', 'project_id', 'deleted']) inspector = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(engine) # There should only be one foreign key here fk = inspector.get_foreign_keys('flavor_projects')[0] self.assertEqual('flavors', fk['referred_table']) self.assertEqual(['id'], fk['referred_columns']) self.assertEqual(['flavor_id'], fk['constrained_columns']) pass

commit_message:
Remove outdated climate.pot

There's no need to have an outdated translation file checked.
For translations, the full file would be needed which can easily
be generated.

Change-Id: I1c89112f977dc74744240317f17ad105adf07ca5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/65/274465/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add with_prologue to exec_command()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 05:40:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/371b8a9538e9a88f6b964b313fbc8c274e9a3f01', 'message': 'Add with_prologue to exec_command()

Closes-Bug: 1530177

The default "set -o pipefail" causing netcat/nc to fail.

config validation.ssh_shell_prologue provides the first level to define
its initial value. In general you can set its default value for all
your tests. However, it will be nice to programmatically set its
value to suit specific need without affecting other tests.

This fix keeps its default behavior, and provides the mechanism to
change its prologue programmatically.

default behavior:
   ssh_client.exec_command("help")
additional behavior:
   ssh_client.exec_command("help", with_prologue="")
   ssh_client.exec_command("help", with_prologue=u"")

Conflicts:

	tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py

commit_message:
Add with_prologue to exec_command()

Closes-Bug: 1530177

The default "set -o pipefail" causing netcat/nc to fail.

config validation.ssh_shell_prologue provides the first level to define
its initial value. In general you can set its default value for all
your tests. However, it will be nice to programmatically set its
value to suit specific need without affecting other tests.

This fix keeps its default behavior, and provides the mechanism to
change its prologue programmatically.

default behavior:
   ssh_client.exec_command("help")
additional behavior:
   ssh_client.exec_command("help", with_prologue="")
   ssh_client.exec_command("help", with_prologue=u"")

Conflicts:

	tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py

Change-Id: I41609bf42e716119e0b01f13b084419f310f334f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/46/284546/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six def exec_command(self, cmd, with_prologue=None): if isinstance(with_prologue, six.string_types): # Allow users bypassing default behavior programmatically. # If and only if with_prologue is instance of string. # Known issue is that the netcat program will fail # with prologue of value "set -o pipefail" cmd = with_prologue + " " + cmd else: cmd = CONF.validation.ssh_shell_prologue + " " + cmd
deleted_lines: def exec_command(self, cmd): cmd = CONF.validation.ssh_shell_prologue + " " + cmd

commit_message:
Make L3 Proactive App the default

Currently we have two different L3 implementations, fully proactive
and reactive, for the mean time lets make the proactive app
the default until we can optimize the local cache
and selective proactive.

Change-Id: I4fab2f56619347694d180352d3b6eea1c8abbd4f

Networking automated tests

Author: Tregubov Yury
Added tests for controller restart nad shutdown in scope of  neutron networking automation.
Accidentely some letters were converted to lowercase in new tets. Fixed
in patchset2.

commit_message:
The versioned object and db operation of Restores

Change-Id: I5705aea6a8fccdfa30ea3a4f9fe6f4730cc1cd58
Closes-Bug: #1545624
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/08/281708/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_versionedobjects import fields from smaug import db from smaug import exception from smaug.i18n import _ from smaug import objects from smaug.objects import base CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @base.SmaugObjectRegistry.register class Restore(base.SmaugPersistentObject, base.SmaugObject, base.SmaugObjectDictCompat, base.SmaugComparableObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.UUIDField(), 'project_id': fields.UUIDField(), 'provider_id': fields.UUIDField(), 'checkpoint_id': fields.UUIDField(), 'restore_target': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'parameters': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'status': fields.StringField(nullable=True), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, restore, db_restore): for name, field in restore.fields.items(): value = db_restore.get(name) if isinstance(field, fields.IntegerField): value = value or 0 elif isinstance(field, fields.DateTimeField): value = value or None restore[name] = value restore._context = context restore.obj_reset_changes() return restore @base.remotable def create(self): if self.obj_attr_is_set('id'): raise exception.ObjectActionError(action='create', reason=_('already created')) updates = self.smaug_obj_get_changes() db_restore = db.restore_create(self._context, updates) self._from_db_object(self._context, self, db_restore) @base.remotable def save(self): updates = self.smaug_obj_get_changes() if updates: db.restore_update(self._context, self.id, updates) self.obj_reset_changes() @base.remotable def destroy(self): with self.obj_as_admin(): db.restore_destroy(self._context, self.id) @base.SmaugObjectRegistry.register class RestoreList(base.ObjectListBase, base.SmaugObject): VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'objects': fields.ListOfObjectsField('Restore'), } @base.remotable_classmethod def get_all(cls, context, marker, limit, sort_keys=None, sort_dirs=None, filters=None, offset=None): restores = db.restore_get_all(context, marker, limit, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs, filters=filters, offset=offset) return base.obj_make_list(context, cls(context), objects.Restore, restores) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_all_by_project(cls, context, project_id, marker, limit, sort_keys=None, sort_dirs=None, filters=None, offset=None): restores = db.restore_get_all_by_project(context, project_id, marker, limit, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs, filters=filters, offset=offset) return base.obj_make_list(context, cls(context), objects.Restore, restores)

commit_message:
disable voting for puppet openstack integration on trusty

Today, Canonical updated Mitaka packaging in "UCA proposed".
It breaks our CI jobs because of some backward incompatible changes.

Until we sort this out in our CI configuration, let's disable voting to
stop blocking development process.

Change-Id: I658c15b2e4e79e99036d647dbaede4c3fed7cb8e

commit_message:
Add `paramiko` in test-requirements

`paramiko` is needed in our test code[1] and required by tempest-lib,
which is in our test-requirements already. But explicit definition
should be good here. So add it in test-requiements.

[1]neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/lib/common/ssh.py

Change-Id: I929f791165d1395465e85477c480a661775495aa

commit_message:
Add local_settings.d/ dir for settings snippets

All files ending with '.py' in local_settings.d/ are evaluated
after reading the settings from local_settings.py . That means
changing the settings can be done without changing local_settings.py .

Change-Id: I0b25ef2c4dada23f8cb66aa5e8af44b3a1cba3b9
Implements: blueprint local-settings-override-mechanism
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/74/243974/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # allow to drop settings snippets into a local_settings_dir LOCAL_SETTINGS_DIR_PATH = os.path.join(ROOT_PATH, "local", "local_settings.d") if os.path.exists(LOCAL_SETTINGS_DIR_PATH): for (dirpath, dirnames, filenames) in os.walk(LOCAL_SETTINGS_DIR_PATH): for filename in filenames: if filename.endswith(".py"): try: execfile(os.path.join(dirpath, filename)) except Exception as e: logging.exception( "Can not exec settings snippet %s" % (filename))

commit_message:
Fix Kuryr devstack installation

docker is autorestarting as its installation as an upstart
service.
stop the service before re-running the daemon.
revert the removal of docker-engine service

Change-Id: Ia2e5700589c391fc1d38246f2271d07a31f542ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/27/282727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo service docker stop || true
deleted_lines: # CentOS/RedHat distros don't start the services just after the package # is installed if it is not explicitily set. So the script fails on # them in this killall because there is nothing to kill. # TODO(devvesa): use a `is_running service` or a more elegant approach sudo killall docker || true

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ha-guide refs/changes/47/284547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "PO-Revision-Date: 2016-02-25 05:11+0000\n"msgid "" "At its core, a cluster is a distributed finite state machine capable of co-" "ordinating the startup and recovery of inter-related services across a set " "of machines." msgstr "" "クラスターは、その中心において、複数のセットのマシン間で関連するサービスのス" "タートアップとリカバリーを調整する機能を持つ、分散有限状態マシンです。" msgid "" "Data integrity through fencing (a non-responsive process does not imply it " "is not doing anything)" msgstr "" "フェンシングによるデータ完全性 (応答なしプロセスが何もしていないことを意味し" "ます)" "It is also possible to follow a segregated approach for one or more " "components that are expected to be a bottleneck and use a collapsed approach " "for the remainder." msgstr "" "1 つ以上のコンポーネントに対して、別々のアプローチをとることができますが、ボ" "トルネックになり、思い出すことが難しいアプローチを使用する可能性があります。" msgid ""msgid "" "OpenStack supports a single-controller high availability mode that is " "managed by the services that manage highly available environments but is not " "actually highly available because no redundant controllers are configured to " "use for failover. This environment can be used for study and demonstration " "but is not appropriate for a production environment." msgstr "" "OpenStack は、シングルコントローラーの高可用性モードをサポートします。これ" "は、高可用性環境を管理するソフトウェアにより、サービスが管理されますが、コン" "トローラーがフェイルオーバーのために冗長化設定されていないため、実際には高可" "用性ではありません。この環境は、学習やデモのために使用できますが、本番環境と" "しては適していません。" msgid "" "Production servers should run (at least) three RabbitMQ servers; for testing " "and demonstration purposes, it is possible to run only two servers. In this " "section, we configure two nodes, called ``rabbit1`` and ``rabbit2``. To " "build a broker, we need to ensure that all nodes have the same Erlang cookie " "file." msgstr "" "本番サーバーは、(少なくとも) 3 つの RabbitMQ サーバーを実行すべきです。テスト" "やデモの目的の場合、サーバーを 2 つだけ実行することもできます。このセクション" "では、``rabbit1`` と ``rabbit2`` という 2 つのノードを設定します。ブローカー" "を構築するために、すべてのノードがきちんと同じ Erlang クッキーファイルを持つ" "必要があります。" "The current design of the neutron LBaaS agent using the HAProxy driver does " "not allow high availability for the tenant load balancers. The neutron-lbaas-" "agent service will be enabled and running on all controllers, allowing for " "load balancers to be distributed across all nodes. However, a controller " "node failure will stop all load balancers running on that node until the " "service is recovered or the load balancer is manually removed and created " "again." msgstr "" "現在の HAProxy ドライバーを使用する neutron LBaaS エージェントは、テナントの" "ロードバランサーの高可用性を実現できません。neutron-lbaas-agent サービスが有" "効化され、すべてのコントローラーにおいて実行され、ロードバランサーがすべての" "ノードにわたり分散されることを許可します。しかしながら、コントローラーノード" "の障害は、サービスが復旧されるまで、またはロードバランサーが手動で削除され、" "再び追加されるまで、そのノードで動作しているロードバランサーをすべて停止しま" "す。" msgid """To ensure that all queues except those with auto-generated names are " "mirrored across all running nodes, set the ``ha-mode`` policy key to all by " "running the following command on one of the nodes:" msgstr "" "自動生成された名前を持つキューを除いて、すべてのキューがすべての動作中のノー" "ドで確実にミラーするために、以下のコマンドをどこかのノードで実行して、 ``ha-" "mode`` ポリシーキーを all に設定します。" msgid """When configuring an OpenStack environment for study or demonstration " "purposes, it is possible to turn off the quorum checking; this is discussed " "later in this guide. Production systems should always run with quorum " "enabled." msgstr "" "学習やデモの目的に OpenStack 環境を設定している場合、クォーラムのチェックを無" "効化できます。このガイドで後から議論します。本番システムは必ずクォーラムを有" "効化して実行すべきです。" msgid """You can have up to 16 cluster members (this is currently limited by the " "ability of corosync to scale higher). In extreme cases, 32 and even up to 64 " "nodes could be possible, however, this is not well tested." msgstr "" "クラスターのメンバーを 16 まで持てます (これは、corosync をよりスケールさせる" "機能による、現在の制限です)。極端な場合、32 や 64 までのノードさえ利用できま" "すが、十分にテストされていません。" msgid ""

commit_message:
Final Oslo releases for Mitaka (except oslo.messaging)

Hopefully last releases for the oslo libraries for Mitaka.
One change in oslo.messaging is still merging, so we can
cut that in a little bit later today.

Change-Id: I05909fbcac58ec58a2e3614ccb65a94b47ff0be0

commit_message:
db_sync doesn't create default domain

The reason db_sync needed to create the default domain is because we
needed a domain for existing v2 users. Since the migrations don't
add the domain_id to users anymore there's no need to create the
default domain.

DocImpact -- The install guide should be updated to say to use
 keystone-manage bootstrap or to create the default domain if the
 deployment is going to support v2.

Change-Id: I65860fe989ac2456b73bcc12fd02643564b24574

commit_message:
Test to validate obj_make_compatible() strips old attributes

This is able to build a mapping of attributes and when they were removed
(assuming that the obj_make_compatible() routines are correct). The mapping
should be reconciled with reality first, and then going forward we can
trust it and use it to make sure we have a reasonable chance of catching
when someone adds a field and doesn't write a rule for it.

Change-Id: I1c37f63b5951ff3f93041adf199595a2fc8c19f5

subject: Port test_emc_vnx to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 13:51:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vnx.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'cinder/volume/configuration.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/f0ef5e50e4bda799d870a5694b01eae73a9f1a58', 'message': "Port test_emc_vnx to Python 3

* Configuration.__getattr__(): replace self.local_conf with
  object.__getattribute__(self, 'local_conf') to avoid reentrant call
  to __getattr__() in copy.copy(conf) on Python 3.
* test_emc_vnx: Don't compare directly provider_location strings but
  set of provider_location items to support hash randomization. On
  Python 3, hash randomization is enabled by default and so
  dictionary items are rendered in an random order.
* test_emc_vnx: use assertIn() to check if the provider_location
  contains 'type^smp' substring. Before, the test failed if the
  substring was a the beginning of the string (position 0).
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vnx

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Related-Bug: 1348818
Change-Id: If3be17ca6a1d14d6f1a16ee9934221f77e161686
"}]
commit_message:
Port test_emc_vnx to Python 3

* Configuration.__getattr__(): replace self.local_conf with
  object.__getattribute__(self, 'local_conf') to avoid reentrant call
  to __getattr__() in copy.copy(conf) on Python 3.
* test_emc_vnx: Don't compare directly provider_location strings but
  set of provider_location items to support hash randomization. On
  Python 3, hash randomization is enabled by default and so
  dictionary items are rendered in an random order.
* test_emc_vnx: use assertIn() to check if the provider_location
  contains 'type^smp' substring. Before, the test failed if the
  substring was a the beginning of the string (position 0).
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vnx

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Related-Bug: 1348818
Change-Id: If3be17ca6a1d14d6f1a16ee9934221f77e161686
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/41/280241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

implementation.

commit_message:
Allow image name to be empty for simple list test

An empty name is valid for an image, but the list_images scheme
is missing the null option, so test_list_images test fails.

This commit brings the list_images scheme in line with the
list_images_detailed schema and allows the name field to be empty,
and both test_list_images and test_list_images_with_detail tests
pass.

Change-Id: Ief037f5145af090dabd677c5d3622c4deef241ed

commit_message:
Implement update_access() method in Hitachi HNAS driver

Implements the new share access interface on the Hitachi HNAS driver
and unit tests, according to blueprint.

Change-Id: I1555c6846f5c0f358cce3e86530768d90a8eccf4
Implements: blueprint hitachi-hnas-driver-share-access
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/66/277366/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_access(self, context, share, access_rules, add_rules=None, delete_rules=None, share_server=None): """Update access rules for given share. :param share: Share that will have the access rules updated. :param access_rules: All access rules for given share. This list is enough to update our access rules for given share. :param add_rules: None or List of access rules which should be added. access_rules already contains these rules. Not used by this driver. :param delete_rules: None or List of access rules which should be removed. access_rules doesn't contain these rules. Not used by this driver. host_list = [] for rule in access_rules: host_list.append(rule.access_to + '(' + rule.access_level + ')') self.hnas.update_access_rule(share_id, host_list) if host_list: LOG.debug("Share %(share)s has the rules: %(rules)s", {'share': share_id, 'rules': ', '.join(host_list)})
deleted_lines: def allow_access(self, context, share, access, share_server=None): """Allow access to a share. :param share: Share to which access will be allowed. :param access: Information about the access that will be allowed, e.g. host allowed, type of access granted. if ('nfs', 'ip') != (share['share_proto'].lower(), access['access_type'].lower()): msg = _("Only NFS protocol and IP access type currently " "supported.") raise exception.InvalidShareAccess(reason=msg) LOG.debug("Sending HNAS Request to allow access to share: " "%(shr)s.", {'shr': (share['id'])}) self._allow_access(share_id, access['access_to'], access['access_level']) LOG.info(_LI("Access allowed successfully to share: %(shr)s."), {'shr': share['id']}) def deny_access(self, context, share, access, share_server=None): """Deny access to a share. :param context: The `context.RequestContext` object for the request :param share: Share to which access will be denied. :param access: Information about the access that will be denied, e.g. host and type of access denied. :param share_server: Data structure with share server information. Not used by this driver. """ if ('nfs', 'ip') != (share['share_proto'].lower(), access['access_type'].lower()): msg = _("Only NFS protocol and IP access type currently " "supported.") raise exception.InvalidShareAccess(reason=msg) LOG.debug("Sending HNAS request to deny access to share:" " %(shr_id)s.", {'shr_id': share['id']}) share_id = self._get_hnas_share_id(share['id']) self._deny_access(share_id, access['access_to'], access['access_level']) LOG.info(_LI("Access denied successfully to share: %(shr)s."), {'shr': share['id']}) def _allow_access(self, share_id, host, permission='rw'): """Allow access to the share. :param share_id: ID of share that access will be allowed. :param host: Host to which access will be allowed. :param permission: permission (e.g. 'rw', 'ro') that will be allowed. """ # check if the share exists self._ensure_share(share_id) # get the list that contains all the hosts allowed on the share host_list = self.hnas.get_host_list(share_id) if permission in ('ro', 'rw'): host_access = host + '(' + permission + ')' else: msg = (_("Permission should be 'ro' or 'rw' instead " "of %s") % permission) raise exception.HNASBackendException(msg=msg) # check if the host(s) is already allowed if any(host in x for x in host_list): if host_access in host_list: LOG.debug("Host: %(host)s is already allowed.", {'host': host}) else: # remove all the hosts with different permissions host_list = [ x for x in host_list if not x.startswith(host)] # add the host with new permission host_list.append(host_access) self.hnas.update_access_rule(share_id, host_list) else: host_list.append(host_access) self.hnas.update_access_rule(share_id, host_list) def _deny_access(self, share_id, host, permission): """Deny access to the share. :param share_id: ID of share that access will be denied. :param host: Host to which access will be denied. :param permission: permission (e.g. 'rw', 'ro') that will be denied. """ # check if the share exists self._ensure_share(share_id) # get the list that contains all the hosts allowed on the share host_list = self.hnas.get_host_list(share_id) if permission in ('ro', 'rw'): host_access = host + '(' + permission + ')' else: msg = (_("Permission should be 'ro' or 'rw' instead " "of %s") % permission) raise exception.HNASBackendException(msg=msg) # check if the host(s) is already not allowed if host_access not in host_list: LOG.debug("Host: %(host)s is already not allowed.", {'host': host}) else: # remove the host on host_list host_list.remove(host_access) self.hnas.update_access_rule(share_id, host_list)

commit_message:
add a place for functional test to block specific regressions

We get some bugs reported in by users which we can replicate and fix
most easily in a full stack way. Having a dedicated place to put these
seems like a good idea. They are in no way an attempt to test all the
things, they are specific tests that demonstrate a bug, and ensure
that once that particular bug is fixed, it will not come back.

Change-Id: Idfd8680133197beabaf6e1ac8df7490c2a345b17
Related-Bug: #1522536

commit_message:
Fix ceilometerclient test to run with old version

The ceilometer client tests fail with python-ceilometerclient versions
less than 2.2.0. The older versions of client libraries cannot be marked
as blacklisted or omitted from requirements for failing UTs, and hence
the test needs to take care of the changes and mock acordingly.

Change-Id: Iefa8a6fdada99a2a291eb4a7a8e792bb5070cd7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/16/277316/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixed make sure to get IPv4 value by awk in sample local.sh file

Since the end user may enable IPv6. the nova-show command will
display network information format randomly. this fix will make
sure always get IPv4 value to avoid error in rest steps

Change-Id: I67542f36645b2f655be951e2ff3136bc8350a914
Closes-bug: #1549091

commit_message:
Add functional tests for update restrict

This adds functional tests for update restrict functionality.

Change-Id: I85e99b376203a48b725c6e9c1d9b5aefa8024b8e
Blueprint: stack-update-restrict
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/40/280140/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heatclient import exc as heat_exceptions from heat_integrationtests.functional import functional_base test_template = { 'heat_template_version': '2013-05-23', 'description': 'Test template to create one instance.', 'resources': { 'bar': { 'type': 'OS::Heat::TestResource', 'properties': { 'value': '1234', 'update_replace': False, } } } } env_update_restrict = {u'resource_registry': { u'resources': { 'bar': {'restricted_actions': 'update'} } } } env_replace_restrict = {u'resource_registry': { u'resources': { 'bar': {'restricted_actions': 'replace'} } } } class UpdateRestrictedStackTest(functional_base.FunctionalTestsBase): def _check_for_restriction_reason(self, events, reason, num_expected=1): matched = [e for e in events if e.resource_status_reason == reason] return len(matched) == num_expected def _check_resource_status(self, stack_identifier, resource_name, status='CREATE_COMPLETE'): try: res = self.client.resources.get( stack_identifier, resource_name) except heat_exceptions.HTTPNotFound: return False return res.resource_status == status def test_update(self): stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=test_template) update_template = test_template.copy() props = update_template['resources']['bar']['properties'] props['value'] = '4567' # check update fails - with 'update' restricted self.update_stack(stack_identifier, update_template, env_update_restrict, expected_status='UPDATE_FAILED') self.assertTrue(self._check_resource_status(stack_identifier, 'bar', 'CREATE_COMPLETE')) resource_events = self.client.events.list( stack_identifier, 'bar') reason = 'update is restricted for resource.' self.assertTrue(self._check_for_restriction_reason(resource_events, reason)) # check update succeeds - with 'replace' restricted self.update_stack(stack_identifier, update_template, env_replace_restrict, expected_status='UPDATE_COMPLETE') self.assertTrue(self._check_resource_status(stack_identifier, 'bar', 'UPDATE_COMPLETE')) resource_events = self.client.events.list( stack_identifier, 'bar') reason = 'update is restricted for resource.' self.assertFalse(self._check_for_restriction_reason(resource_events, reason, 2)) def test_replace(self): stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=test_template) update_template = test_template.copy() props = update_template['resources']['bar']['properties'] props['update_replace'] = True # check replace fails - with 'replace' restricted self.update_stack(stack_identifier, update_template, env_replace_restrict, expected_status='UPDATE_FAILED') self.assertTrue(self._check_resource_status(stack_identifier, 'bar', 'CREATE_COMPLETE')) resource_events = self.client.events.list( stack_identifier, 'bar') reason = 'replace is restricted for resource.' self.assertTrue(self._check_for_restriction_reason(resource_events, reason)) # check replace succeeds - with 'update' restricted self.update_stack(stack_identifier, update_template, env_update_restrict, expected_status='UPDATE_COMPLETE') self.assertTrue(self._check_resource_status(stack_identifier, 'bar', 'CREATE_COMPLETE')) resource_events = self.client.events.list( stack_identifier, 'bar') reason = 'replace is restricted for resource.' self.assertFalse(self._check_for_restriction_reason(resource_events, reason, 2)) def test_update_type_changed(self): stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=test_template) update_template = test_template.copy() rsrc = update_template['resources']['bar'] rsrc['type'] = 'OS::Heat::None' # check replace fails - with 'replace' restricted self.update_stack(stack_identifier, update_template, env_replace_restrict, expected_status='UPDATE_FAILED') self.assertTrue(self._check_resource_status(stack_identifier, 'bar', 'CREATE_COMPLETE')) resource_events = self.client.events.list( stack_identifier, 'bar') reason = 'replace is restricted for resource.' self.assertTrue(self._check_for_restriction_reason(resource_events, reason)) # check replace succeeds - with 'update' restricted self.update_stack(stack_identifier, update_template, env_update_restrict, expected_status='UPDATE_COMPLETE') self.assertTrue(self._check_resource_status(stack_identifier, 'bar', 'CREATE_COMPLETE')) resource_events = self.client.events.list( stack_identifier, 'bar') reason = 'replace is restricted for resource.' self.assertFalse(self._check_for_restriction_reason(resource_events, reason, 2))

commit_message:
[cli-ref] Update python-saharaclient to 0.12.0

Change-Id: Ie54aaaddb1ee1170e42e6a683165d04211ee76ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/23/283623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`sahara` version ``0.12.0``.
deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`sahara` version ``0.11.1``.``--insecure`` Explicitly allow client to perform "insecure" TLS (https) requests. The server's certificate will not be verified against any certificate authorities. This option should be used with caution. ``--os-cacert <ca-certificate>`` Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying a TLS (https) server certificate. Defaults to ``env[OS_CACERT]``. ``--os-cert <certificate>`` Defaults to ``env[OS_CERT]``. ``--os-key <key>`` Defaults to ``env[OS_KEY]``. ``--timeout <seconds>`` Set request timeout (in seconds).

commit_message:
Add trust info into heat params

Add trust info into heat params. If any service wants to use the
trust, it can get the info from the heat params.

Change-Id: I406a80d0d4fc92c6045b902945198a0d765f1123
Partially-Implements: blueprint create-trustee-user-for-each-bay
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/07/282207/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Allow apache file overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 18:03:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/dddbb527e080d79fe07df8b9442772dd50d13f50', 'message': '[WIP]Allow apache file overrides

This commit extends the config_template action plugin to allow apache
directives to be overridden and/or added.

This would act as a stepping stone for what I believe could be neat
features in OSA. Follow up doc patches could elaborate how to use
these overrides to deploy features that involve identity configuration
and any other configuration for services utilizing httpd/mod_wsgi.
We could have example AIO "packages" or playbooks that deploy an
all-in-one with only features that deployers care about. Keystone
Federation could be more easily documented, extended, and deployed with
apache config overrides and documented tutorials.

Notes:

* The library used to parse apache configuration files is fairly new, but
  has a decent set of tests right now. Ideally the playbooks would perform
  a check to see if the apache config file that has been overridden is a
  valid apache configuration file.

* Upgrades would need to include the libraries utilized by this patchset

* Documentation has been added in the install-guide to assist deployers
  with the apache config override process

* I would really like some feedback around whether or not this is a good idea.
  That way I know what needs to get better in order to make this a reality.
  Especially on the library. The library can be found here:
  www.github.com/alextricty25/parse_apache_configs

UpgradeImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iaff98d7908be099417adfba9c082e54553d04d90

commit_message:
Allow apache file overrides

This commit extends the config_template action plugin to allow apache
directives to be overridden and/or added.

Notes:

* The library used to parse apache configuration files is fairly new, but
  has a decent set of tests right now. Ideally the playbooks would perform
  a check to see if the apache config file that has been overridden is a
  valid apache configuration file.

* Upgrades would need to include the libraries utilized by this patchset

* Documentation has been added in the install-guide to assist deployers
  with the apache config override process

* I would really like some feedback around whether or not this is a good idea.
  That way I know what needs to get better in order to make this a reality.
  Especially on the library. The library can be found here:
  www.github.com/alextricty25/parse_apache_configs

UpgradeImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iaff98d7908be099417adfba9c082e54553d04d90
Depends-On: Ia737a74e8c8f7a0b23b4359459a571ee91180b78

Remove the rest of MidoNet plugin from Neutron tree.

commit_message:
Description of Network Components

Brief description of various network components, switches, routers, firewalls and load balancers.

Change-Id: I53551382b2f07581ba9d50c3f187457c24d4aead
Closes-Bug: #1466292
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/71/282171/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Switches are special devices that enable packets to travel from one node to another. They are multi input / multi output devices. Hosts belonging to the same network are connected using switches. Switches enable forwarding of the packet received on one port (input) to another port (output) so that they reach the desired destination node. Switches operate at Layer 2 in the networking model. They route the traffic based on the destination ethernet address in the packet header.Routers are enhanced switches that enables packets to travel from one network to another network. Routers enable communication between 2 nodes on different networks that are not directly connected to each other. Routers operate at Layer 3 in the networking model. They route the traffic based on the destination IP address in the packet header.Firewalls are used to regulate traffic to and from a host or a network. Firewalls can either be a specialized device connecting two networks or can be a software based filtering mechanism implemented on an operating system. Firewalls are used to restrict traffic to a host based on the rules defined on the host. It can filtered packets based on several criteria such as source ip address, destination ip address, port numbers, connection state, etc. It is primarily used to protect the hosts from unauthorized access and malicious attacks. Linux based OS implements firewalls through iptables.Load balancer can be a software or a hardware based device that allows traffic to be evenly distributed across several applications. By distributing the traffic across multiple servers it avoids overload of a single server thereby preventing a single point of failure in the product.This further improves the performance, network throughput and response time of the servers. Load balancers are typically used in a 3-tier architecture. In this model, a request from the front end web server is received by a load balancer which then forwards the request to one of the available backend DB servers for processing. The response from the DB server is passed back to the web server for further processing.
deleted_lines: A switch is a device that is used to connect devices on a network. Switches forward packets on to other devices, using packet switching to pass data along only to devices that need to receive it. Switches operate at layer 2 of the OSI model.A router is a networking device that connects multiple networks together. Routers are connected to two or more networks. When they receive data packets, they use a routing table to determine which networks to pass the information to.A firewall is a network device that controls the incoming and outgoing network traffic based on an applied rule set.A load balancer is a network device that distributes network or application traffic across a number of servers.

commit_message:
Update default domain's description

The default domain's description references v2. This is wrong in v3-only
deployments, or when CONF.identity.default_domain_id is used to specify
a different domain for v2. This change updates the description.

Change-Id: Ia8357bea00e3273015968015cdffa59d98a19159
Closes-Bug: #1546605

commit_message:
EMC Isilon Driver Support For CIFS Read-Only Share

Added support for read-only shares to the CIFS protocol in the Isilon
driver.

Change-Id: I0dacb5538071af31cd07a187fead1b34e19db58d
Implements: blueprint emc-isilon-driver-readonly-share

subject: Fix target capacity calculation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 01:38:39.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/policies/scaling_policy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/a3b7224da3d45458af59d0ade4814b10e789b24d', 'message': "Fix target capacity calculation

When the 'best_effort' property is set to True, we should not blindly
substract the current size by the min_size and use the result as target
capacity. There could be cases where the 'count' is less than the
difference. We should still respect the 'count' in those cases.

This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I371fa352969e89a21ddc2a686c1da730e867e410
"}]
commit_message:
Fix target capacity calculation

When the 'best_effort' property is set to True, we should not blindly
substract the current size by the min_size and use the result as target
capacity. There could be cases where the 'count' is less than the
difference. We should still respect the 'count' in those cases.

This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I371fa352969e89a21ddc2a686c1da730e867e410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/95/284495/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: count = min(count, current - cluster.min_size) count = min(count, cluster.max_size - current)
deleted_lines: count = current - cluster.min_size count = cluster.max_size - current

added_lines: %global sname oslo.context Name: {{ 'oslo.context' | py2pkg }} Version: 0.6.0 Release: 0 Summary: OpenStack Oslo context library Group: Development/Languages License: {{ 'Apache-2.0' | license }} Url: https://launchpad.net/%{sname} Source0: https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/o/%{sname}/%{sname}-%{version}.tar.gz BuildRequires: openstack-macros BuildRequires: {{ 'Babel' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'coverage' | py2pkg }} >= 3.6 BuildRequires: {{ 'hacking' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'oslo.test' | py2pkg }} >= 1.10.0 BuildRequires: {{ 'pbr' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'python-subunit' | py2pkg }} >= 0.0.18 BuildRequires: {{ 'testrepository' | py2pkg }} >= 0.0.18 BuildRequires: {{ 'testscenarios' | py2pkg }} >= 0.4 BuildRequires: {{ 'testtools' | py2pkg }} >= 0.9.34 Requires: {{ 'Babel' | py2pkg }} >= 1.3 Provides: python-oslo.context BuildArch: noarch %description The Oslo context library has helpers to maintain useful information about a request context. The request context is usually populated in the WSGI pipeline and used by various modules such as logging. %package doc Summary: Documentation for OpenStack common configuration library Group: Documentation BuildRequires: {{ 'Sphinx' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'oslosphinx' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'fixtures' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: git %description doc Documentation for the oslo-context library. %prep %setup -q -n %{sname}-%{version} # Remove bundled egg-info rm -rf %{sname}.egg-info %build %{__python2} setup.py build %install %{__python2} setup.py install -O1 --skip-build --root %{buildroot} # generate html docs python setup.py build_sphinx # remove the sphinx-build leftovers rm -rf doc/build/html/.{doctrees,buildinfo} %check export PYTHONPATH="%{python2_sitelib}:%{buildroot}%{python2_sitelib}" export PYTHON="python -S" testr init && testr run --parallel %files %{python_sitelib}/oslo* %{python_sitelib}/oslo_context/* %files doc %doc LICENSE doc/build/html %changelog

commit_message:
Tintri image cache cleanup

Cleanup image snapshots periodically from image cache.
Config option helps user to determine how old image snapshots
could be retained.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1534850

added_lines: import datetimeimport threading cfg.StrOpt('tintri_image_cache_expiry_days', default=30, help='Delete unused image snapshots older than mentioned days'), self.cache_cleanup = False self._image_cache_expiry = int( getattr(self.configuration, 'tintri_image_cache_expiry_days', CONF.tintri_image_cache_expiry_days)) @utils.synchronized('cache_cleanup') def _initiate_image_cache_cleanup(self): if self.cache_cleanup: LOG.debug('Image cache cleanup in progress.') return else: self.cache_cleanup = True t = threading.Timer(0, self._cleanup_cache) t.start() def _cleanup_cache(self): LOG.debug('Cache cleanup: starting.') try: # Cleanup used cached image snapshots 30 days and older t = datetime.datetime.utcnow() - datetime.timedelta( days=self._image_cache_expiry) date = t.strftime("%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S") with self._get_client() as c: # Get eligible snapshots to clean image_snaps = c.get_image_snapshots_to_date(date) if image_snaps: for snap in image_snaps: uuid = snap['uuid']['uuid'] LOG.debug( 'Cache cleanup: deleting image snapshot %s', uuid) try: c.delete_snapshot(uuid) except Exception: LOG.warning(_LW('Unexpected exception during ' 'cache cleanup of snapshot %s'), uuid) else: LOG.debug('Cache cleanup: nothing to clean') finally: self.cache_cleanup = False LOG.debug('Cache cleanup: finished') self._initiate_image_cache_cleanup() def get_image_snapshots_to_date(self, date): filter = {'sortedBy': 'createTime', 'target': 'SNAPSHOT', 'consistency': 'CRASH_CONSISTENT', 'hasClone': 'No', 'type': 'CINDER_GENERATED_SNAPSHOT', 'contain': 'image-', 'limit': '100', 'page': '1', 'sortOrder': 'DESC', 'since': '1970-01-01T00:00:00', 'until': date, } payload = '/' + self.api_version + '/snapshot' r = self.get_query(payload, filter) if r.status_code != 200: msg = _('Failed to get image snapshots.') raise exception.VolumeDriverException(msg) return r.json()['items']

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/50/284350/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
hzTableFooter.$inject = ['horizon.framework.widgets.basePath', '$compile']; * The `hzTableFooter` directive provides markup for a general table footer. * It takes an array of table items. By default, it simply prints out * 'Displaying x items'. However, you can provide a custom template message. * It will override the span tag in hz-table-footer.html. * @example * ``` * * ... * *
* ``` * * or * * var message = "{$ items.length $} items"; * ``` * * ... * *
* ``` * function hzTableFooter(basePath, $compile) { transclude: true, link: link function link(scope, element, attrs) { // use the message template if provided by the user if (attrs.message) { element.find('td span').replaceWith($compile(attrs.message)(scope)); } }

Some catched exception with ``except XXX as e:`` raise with exception like

commit_message:
Raise with traceback

Some catched exception with ``except XXX as e:`` raise with exception like
``raise e``, but in this way we lose the traceback.
Now that we do not translate one exception into another, we'd better raise with
traceback.
ref:
http://www.markbetz.net/2014/04/30/re-raising-exceptions-in-python/

Change-Id: Iaf4ed74ac165bea2e6a3424564c50ddef5640394
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/35/282635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except ks_exc.Conflict: raise
deleted_lines: except ks_exc.Conflict as e: raise e

commit_message:
Revised TODO list

This patch proposes a revision to the TODO list. Changes include:

- Move policy documentation to mitaka work items etherpad because we are
  already on it.
- Move advanced filtering support back from etherpad because we don't
  have bandwidth to work on it in near term.
- Move support to 'os-request-id' back from etherpad for the same
  reason.
- Format changes to some external links.

Change-Id: Iae059b2b067a4067f789f43842169f9d6ae5bc22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/15/283915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Investigate the impact of node-create and node-delete on certain policies. - Support advanced filters as suggested by the API WG: `Filtering Guidelines`_ - Support to ``os-request-id`` when serving api requests. - Add support to template_url for heat stack profile. If template and template_url to those notifications accordingly: `Autoscaling Notifications`_ .. _`Filtering Guidelines`: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/pagination_filter_sort.html#filtering .. _`Autoscaling Notifications`: https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/46495/heat-autoscaling-adaptation-actions-on-existing-servers/
deleted_lines: - [???] Investigate the impact of node-create and node-delete on certain policies. DOC ----- - Provide document(or docstring) for policy data passing for developers. - Provide documentation for existing policies. - According to the guidelines from API WG, we need to support `page_reverse` as a pagination parameter. https://review.openstack.org/190743 - [???] Add support to template_url for heat stack profile. If template and template_url to those notifications accordingly. [https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/46495/heat-autoscaling-adaptation-actions-on-existing-servers/]

commit_message:
Stop using non-existent method of Mock

There is no method called_once_with() in Mock object.
Use assert_called_once_with() instead.

Change-Id: Ib41a3fb4d7b4333cb56f69244fed0bf13366453d
Closes-Bug: #1544522

commit_message:
Use unique SNI identifier when building data model

The to_data_model method previously labeled an SNI container without a
unique identifier, using the "listener_id".  Now it will use the
"tls_container_id" to ensure it is truly unique.

Change-Id: I174f8f650fc51668fd7b70e845d4706916f06295

commit_message:
Skip the test_get_service_by_host_name

This patch skips the test_get_service_by_host_name to get cinder
changes merged [1]. String for host could include host@backend info.
The service cinder-volume has got the info for host in this format and
therefore it is missing in the service list.

[1] I21775106693176ca128dbfd9db0d43cfc58de00a

Related-Bug: #1530144
Change-Id: I4044ab15078ecf54447e1c6e67c27fc8d7c9d6f7

commit_message:
Use proper way to initialize nova client

Avoid the warning message below:
UserWarning: 'get_client_class' is deprecated. Please use
`novaclient.client.Client` instead.

passing any detail but the ip version also behaves unexpectedly
depending on the state of the system.

Whilst this could be considered convenient in some circumstances,
it is problematic for a couple of reasons: a) it breaks a well defined
contract (backward compat of the subnet-create command), and b) it

mandatory to specify CIDR/IP version regardless of the conditions under
which the request is issued. On the other hand, associating subnets to
subnet pools, will have to be more prescriptive, and require the user
to explicitly state his/her intentions when creating the subnet: if a
user does want a subnet (CIDR) to belong to a subnet pool, he/she will
have to state so, either by specifying a subnetpool name/uuid, or by
asking for a default one. This will be tackled in the context of a
different patch. As stated above, this patch will limit itself to
restoring the behavior of the subnet_create as it used to be.

Closes-bug: 1545199

Change-Id: Idf516ed9db24d779742cdff0584b48182a8502d6

commit_message:
Preserve subnet_create behavior in presence of subnet pools

The development of the auto_allocate extension, which relies on subnet
pools, revealed some discrepancies in the behavior of the subnet_create
API: if a user specifies a cidr on subnet_create like he/she is used
to, the API outcome changes in presence of default subnetpools. For
instance the command 'neutron subnet-create network <cidr>' returns a
subnet associated to a pool, if a default pool exists, but it does not
otherwise. At the same time, attempting to create a subnet without
passing any detail but the ip version also behaves unexpectedly
depending on the state of the system.

Whilst this could be considered convenient in some circumstances,
it is problematic for a couple of reasons: a) it breaks a well defined
contract (backward compat of the subnet-create command), and b) it
leads to ambiguity of the API.

This patch restores the semantic of the subnet_create API where it is
mandatory to specify CIDR/IP version regardless of the conditions
under which the request is issued. On the other hand, associating
subnets to subnet pools will have to be more prescriptive, and
require the user to explicitly state his/her intentions when creating
the subnet: if a user does want a subnet (CIDR) to belong to a subnet
pool, he/she will have to state so, either by specifying a subnetpool
name/uuid, or by asking for a default one.

This will be tackled as a follow-up, especially in order to address the
needs of prefix delegation which currently rely on the ambiguous
behavior that this patch is fixing.

Closes-bug: 1545199

DocImpact: subnetpools can be used to simplify IPAM, and can be specified
during subnet creation.

Change-Id: Idf516ed9db24d779742cdff0584b48182a8502d6

commit_message:
Clarify user config loading in dynamic inventory

Arg name, config directory searching function and error messaging
have all been refactored for greater clarity of intent and function

Change-Id: I3573c1a59c55473aafe59836438f15d01962fb49

added_lines: Updating user-configured SSL certificates for Horizon ----------------------------------------------------- In Kilo, the variables for user-configured SSL certificates have changed. These variables must be adjusted when upgrading from Juno to Kilo:: Kilo Juno ---- ---- horizon_ssl_cert -> horizon_user_ssl_cert horizon_ssl_key -> horizon_user_ssl_key User-provided CA certificates are now specified by ``horizon_user_ssl_ca_cert`` variable.

Docs: Manual nova_spice_console removal

This patch explains how to manually remove nova-consoleauth service
entries left over from the upgrade to Kilo.

Closes-bug: 1487155

commit_message:
Move swift memcache conf into separate file

The memcache configuration was only setup for the proxy-server.conf
within Swift, and was not set for the object and container reconcilers
which both use memcache.

This patch moves the memcache settings into a separate memcache.conf
file which is then configured on all swift hosts, removing the specific
conf from the proxy-server.conf file.

Change-Id: I047b2d1178de43c694c30280f6ed9fe8511341fd
Closes-Bug: #1542121
(cherry picked from commit 140f3772e5078052c5903e3da6b0d79c2f466461)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/69/281269/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [memcache] # You can use this single conf file instead of having memcache_servers set in # several other conf files under [filter:cache] for example. You can specify # multiple servers separated with commas, as in: 10.1.2.3:11211,10.1.2.4:11211 # (IPv6 addresses must follow rfc3986 section-3.2.2, i.e. [::1]:11211) # memcache_servers = 127.0.0.1:11211 memcache_servers = {{ memcached_servers }} # # Sets how memcache values are serialized and deserialized: # 0 = older, insecure pickle serialization # 1 = json serialization but pickles can still be read (still insecure) # 2 = json serialization only (secure and the default) # To avoid an instant full cache flush, existing installations should # upgrade with 0, then set to 1 and reload, then after some time (24 hours) # set to 2 and reload. # In the future, the ability to use pickle serialization will be removed. # memcache_serialization_support = 2 memcache_serialization_support = 2 # # Sets the maximum number of connections to each memcached server per worker # memcache_max_connections = 2 # # Timeout for connection # connect_timeout = 0.3 # Timeout for pooled connection # pool_timeout = 1.0 # number of servers to retry on failures getting a pooled connection # tries = 3 # Timeout for read and writes # io_timeout = 2.0

commit_message:
Do not setup messaging host and user when Rabbit is not installed

When RabbitMQ is not installed (affinity: 0), because it is not used
in a Stand-Alone Swift installation, do not setup messaging vhost and
user for the various services.

Note: The only change that is actually needed is in Keystone, but all
other services have been updated for consistency and clarity.

Change-Id: Ibbf6e76d9cb9263db3aa141225df4f9ba539dce9

A basic implement Checkpoint Collection

TODO(luobin) pass class CheckpointCollection(object): def __init__(self, context): super(CheckpointCollection, self).__init__() self.checkpoint_serializer = None bank_plugin_cls = importutils.import_class(CONF.bank_plugin) self.bank_plugin = bank_plugin_cls(context) # TODO(luobin) def list(self, prefix): try: container = "checkpoints" prefix = prefix self.bank_plugin.ch_container(container=container) object_names = self.bank_plugin.list_objects(prefix=prefix) return object_names except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("list checkpoints failed, err: %s" % err) raise err def show(self, checkpoint_id): try: # Get checkpoint in bank container = "checkpoints" prefix = "" obj = checkpoint_id value = self._get_object(container=container, prefix=prefix, obj=obj) except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("get checkpoint failed.") raise err # TODO(luobin): deserialize checkpoint checkpoint = self.checkpoint_serializer. \ deserialize(data=value, format="json") return checkpoint def delete(self, checkpoint_id): try: # Show checkpoint checkpoint = self.show(checkpoint_id) if checkpoint.status == "available": # Mark checkpoint as being deleted self.update(checkpoint, status="deleting") else: return except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("delete checkpoint failed, err: %s" % err) def create(self, plan): # check lease validity if self.bank_plugin.check_lease_validity() is True: # TODO(luobin): create checkpoint_id checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) try: # TODO(luobin): create a checkpoint obj checkpoint = Checkpoint(plan, checkpoint_id) # Create checkpoint in bank container = "checkpoints" prefix = "" obj = checkpoint_id # TODO(luobin): serialize a checkpoint value = self.checkpoint_serializer. \ serialize(checkpoint, encoding_format="json") self._create_object(container=container, prefix=prefix, obj=obj, value=value) except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("create checkpoint failed, err: %s" % err) else: LOG.err("create checkpoint failed, check_lease_validity failed.") def update(self, checkpoint, **kwargs): # TODO(luobin): Update checkpoint object checkpoint = self._update_checkpoint(checkpoint, **kwargs) if self.bank_plugin.check_lease_validity() is True: try: # Update checkpoint in bank container = "checkpoints" prefix = "" obj = checkpoint.checkpoint_id # TODO(luobin): serialize checkpoint value = self.checkpoint_serializer. \ serialize(checkpoint, encoding_format="json") self._update_object(container=container, prefix=prefix, obj=obj, value=value) except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("update checkpoint failed, err: %s" % err) else: LOG.err("update checkpoint failed, check_lease_validity failed.") def _generate_object_name_with_prefix(self, prefix, obj): object_name = prefix + obj return object_name def _create_object(self, container, prefix, obj, value): # change container self.bank_plugin.ch_container(container=container) # generate object name object_name = self._generate_object_name_with_prefix(prefix, obj) # create object try: self.bank_plugin.create_object(key=object_name, value=value) except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("create object failed.") raise err def _update_object(self, container, prefix, obj, value): # change container self.bank_plugin.ch_container(container=container) # generate object name object_name = self._generate_object_name_with_prefix(prefix, obj) # update object try: self.bank_plugin.update_object(key=object_name, value=value) except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("update object failed.") raise err def _get_object(self, container, prefix, obj): # change container self.bank_plugin.ch_container(container=container) # generate object name object_name = self._generate_object_name_with_prefix(prefix, obj) # get object try: value = self.bank_plugin.get_object(key=object_name) return value except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("get object failed.") raise err def _delete_object(self, container, prefix, obj): # change container self.bank_plugin.ch_container(container=container) # generate object name object_name = self._generate_object_name_with_prefix(prefix, obj) # update object try: self.bank_plugin.delete_object(key=object_name) except SmaugException as err: LOG.err("delete object failed.") raise err def _update_checkpoint(self, checkpoint, **kwargs): # TODO(luobin): update checkpoint object return checkpoint

commit_message:
Do not reveal auth token in swiftclient log messages by default

Currently the swiftclient logs sensitive info in headers when logging
HTTP requests. This patch hides sensitive info in headers such as
'X-Auth-Token' in a similar way to swift itself (we add a
'reveal_sensitive_prefix' configuration to the client).

With this patch, tokens are truncated by removing the specified number
of characters, after which '...' is appended to the logged token to
indicate that it has been redacted.

Co-Authored-By: Li Cheng <shcli@cn.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Zack M. Davis <zdavis@swiftstack.com>
Change-Id: I43dd7254f7281d4db59b286aa2145643c64e1705
Closes-bug: #1516692
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/63/282363/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: logger_settings = { 'reveal_sensitive_prefix': 16 } LOGGER_SENSITIVE_HEADERS = [ 'x-auth-token', 'x-service-token', 'x-auth-key', 'set-cookie'] def safe_value(name, value): """ Only show up to logger_settings['reveal_sensitive_prefix'] characters from a sensitive header. :param name: Header name :param value: Header value :return: Safe (header, value) pair """ prefix_length = logger_settings.get('reveal_sensitive_prefix', 16) if name.lower() in LOGGER_SENSITIVE_HEADERS: if value and len(value) > prefix_length: return name, value[0:prefix_length] + '...' return (name, value) def scrub(headers): """Redact header values that can contain sensitive information that should not be logged.""" # `headers` argument can be either a dict or an iterable of two-element # tuples if isinstance(headers, dict): headers = headers.items() scrubbed_headers = dict(safe_value(key, val) for (key, val) in headers) return scrubbed_headers headers = kwargs['headers'] if logger_settings.get('reveal_sensitive_prefix', 16): headers = scrub(headers) for element in headers: header = ' -H "%s: %s"' % (element, headers[element]) log_method("RESP HEADERS: %s", scrub(resp.getheaders()))
deleted_lines: for element in kwargs['headers']: header = ' -H "%s: %s"' % (element, kwargs['headers'][element]) log_method("RESP HEADERS: %s", resp.getheaders())

commit_message:
Unify the driver config opts

mgmt_driver, monitor_driver and infra_driver are configuration
items. Some of them are multistropt, some are listopt.
This patch uses the listopt for all of them.

In addition, rename drivers dir into infra_drivers.

Change-Id: I5bbc7b6a52d97dae8bbca7dd2e804b7c50c8f7a4
Closes-bug: 1524255

commit_message:
make releasenotes use zuul cloner with requirements

Release notes jobs should also use zuul cloner with requirements, much
like the docs jobs do. This lets projects opt into having their
releasenotes be constraints by requirements.

Change-Id: I09ff0850e132e86a82cb9f4fcf08551e90fa11b6

commit_message:
Use isCurrentProject in NG images delete action

The delete action can use the newly created userSession service
.isCurrentProject().

To test set DISABLED = False in _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py

Change-Id: I37a6840c4369d319f745ec8315731fe178dc603b
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Remove migration_helpers.get_default_domain

Since a default domain isn't created during migration,
get_default_domain() shouldn't be a migration helper.

Closes-Bug: 1547214
Change-Id: I0e0cfd3ad9d7c6ab91e693a6122bf43abfcd6321
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/49/282049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.default_domain = { 'id': CONF.identity.default_domain_id, 'name': 'Default', }
deleted_lines: from keystone.common.sql import migration_helpers self.default_domain = migration_helpers.get_default_domain()
