commit_message:
Tablecontroller should return only selected items

Tablecontroller currently returns a map of items that were
checked/unchecked. Which is confusingly called selected.

Currently, to get the actual selected items, We have to manually filter
through the list. This patch adds a selected field that returns a array
containing only the selected items.

Change-Id: I84bea8931c23cfcaa654e437d39b4faf8ae730e4
Closes-Bug: #1545861

commit_message:
Remove 'deleteServerMetadataItem' from image API

The said method doesn't belong to the image API, it instead belong to
the metadata API.

Change-Id: I688de5449cdea5cc8c83036208706b70da30d4e0

subject: Change approach to request storage url for multi-tenant store
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 12:45:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/bb4bc90bed20e47590613a6ecbe269a1b6a9ec8b', 'message': "Change approach to request storage url for multi-tenant store

Multi-tenant store doesn't need to fetch swift storage_url from
store location because it can fetch it from service catalog
in user context.
That allows to avoid subtle errors when uploading/downloading
with scheme = 'swift+config'. In the current implementation
multi-tenant store uses location.swift_url to request swift
endpoint but swift_url is keystone endpoint in that case.
The change provides possibility to get rid of this dependency
and consider context as primary source for swift store url.

Change-Id: I7bc23dfc11900b55f45fe98144d14f883c381c9f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-03 15:22:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/58a1784bb4969bcdf7f20a12eec336c2a4beb2cd', 'message': "Change approach to request storage url for multi-tenant store

Multi-tenant store doesn't need to fetch swift storage_url from
store location because it can fetch it from service catalog
in user context.
That allows to avoid subtle errors when uploading/downloading
with scheme = 'swift+config'. In the current implementation
multi-tenant store uses location.swift_url to request swift
endpoint but swift_url is keystone endpoint in that case.
The change provides possibility to get rid of this dependency
and consider context as primary source for swift store url.

Closes-Bug: #1511025

Change-Id: I7bc23dfc11900b55f45fe98144d14f883c381c9f
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-19 11:38:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/534af89d510ca5c7e3dfbf733a65ce7873fbdad5', 'message': "Change approach to request storage url for multi-tenant store

in user context.
That allows to avoid subtle errors when uploading/downloading
with scheme = 'swift+config'. In the current implementation
multi-tenant store uses location.swift_url to request swift
endpoint but swift_url is keystone endpoint in that case.
The change provides possibility to get rid of this dependency
and consider context as primary source for swift store url.

Closes-Bug: #1511025

Change-Id: I7bc23dfc11900b55f45fe98144d14f883c381c9f
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-28 10:46:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/dcd18117ebcb532ea39f738ea14185d4ce4c1d1d', 'message': "Change approach to request storage url for multi-tenant store

Multi-tenant store doesn't need to fetch swift storage_url from
store location because it can fetch it from service catalog
in user context.
That allows to avoid subtle errors when uploading/downloading
with scheme = 'swift+config'. In the current implementation
multi-tenant store uses location.swift_url to request swift
endpoint but swift_url is keystone endpoint in that case.
The change provides possibility to get rid of this dependency
and consider context as primary source for swift store url.

commit_message:
Change approach to request storage url for multi-tenant store

Multi-tenant store doesn't need to fetch swift storage_url from
store location because it can fetch it from service catalog
in user context.
That allows to avoid subtle errors when uploading/downloading
with scheme = 'swift+config'. In the current implementation
multi-tenant store uses location.swift_url to request swift
endpoint but swift_url is keystone endpoint in that case.
The change provides possibility to get rid of this dependency
and consider context as primary source for swift store url.

Closes-Bug: #1511025

Change-Id: I7bc23dfc11900b55f45fe98144d14f883c381c9f

commit_message:
[microversions] fix help msg for versioned args

If command has arguments with one name, but for different versions(see an
example below), both arguments will be displayed. This patch fixes this
issue.

Example of arguments:

    @cliutils.args("name",
                   help="Name of a good action.",
                   start_version="2.1",
                   end_version="2.20")
    @cliutils.args("name",
                   help="Name of a very good action.",
                   start_version="2.21")
    def do_something_good(cs, args):
        pass

Example of helpoutput before patch:

    Positional arguments:
      <name>    Name of a good action. (Supported by API versions '2.0' - '2.20')
      <name>    Name of a very good action. (Supported by API versions '2.21' -
                '2.latest')

Change-Id: I59f155675e2aae642a5b90cb70008eb5647ffe79

commit_message:
Casts algorithm to lower case in KMIP plugin.

The KMIP plugin verifies if an algorithm that was given by
the end user is supported by the KMIP plugin.After verification,
the algorithm needs to be casted to lower case.If not, then
an error will occur and the KMIP plugin will fail to generate
the secret.

Change-Id: I0b21b0310e5aa445045258d3a89f2dbedf2809ef
Closes-Bug: 1537182

commit_message:
Disable freezer-agent from logging to output stream

Stop freezer-agent from printing logging info to output stream and
force it to use log-file. Also this patch fix the printing out the
metadata to output stream

Change-Id: I5ce0a3365c0ee5947ef880f3d585e777c678549a
Closes-Bug: #1549220

added_lines: # disable freezer from logging to stderr CONF.set_override('use_stderr', False) if not CONF.get('log_file'): CONF.set_override('log_file', levels.get(defaults['log_file'], log.NOTSET)) CONF.set_override('verbose', False) # if an options provided twice, we take the one from the cli and ignore # the one from config file opts = dict([(x,y) for x,y in CONF._namespace._cli.iteritems() if y != defaults.get(x)and y is not None ]) # Freezer calls __version__ from backup_args everywhere, we have to # hardcode it here ! opts['__version__'] = FREEZER_VERSION defaults.update(opts)

commit_message:
Deprecation warning in tempest-lib

Add a depreaction warning to tempest-lib to let our users know
they should switch to tempest.lib if they want the latest and
greatest fixes and functionalities.

Partially implements bp tempest-lib-reintegration

Change-Id: I316f5b3c00d50345761b7678297b894730d968e5

Please change your imports from tempest_lib to tempest.lib', DeprecationWarning) # And back to normal! warnings.resetwarnings()

commit_message:
add reno

Set up reno so the release tools that manipulate the reno config have
something to be tested against.

Change-Id: I5620d57283729313dca3c36853ef71f70100635e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-test refs/changes/83/284383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
